rdf:resource="http://eidchub.ceh.ac.uk/metadata/e5d00d66-dcf5-4b0e-9346-f6205a336385"/>       </file:File>     </dcterms:hasPart>     <documentcontainer:catalogLink>http://data.ceh.ac.uk/metadata/e5d00d66-dcf5-4b0e-9346-f6205a336385</documentcontainer:catalogLink>     <dcterms:description xml:lang="en">The WATCH Forcing data is a twentieth century meteorological forcing dataset for land surface and hydrological models. It consists of three/six-hourly states of the weather for global half-degree land grid points. It was generated as part of the EU FP 6 project "WATCH" (WATer and global CHange") which ran from 2007-2011. The data was generated in 2 tranches with slightly different methodology: 1901-1957 and 1958-2001, but generally the dataset can be considered as continuous.  More details regarding the generation process can be found in the associated WATCH technical report and paper in J. Hydrometeorology.   To understand how the data grid is formed it is necessary to read the attached WFD-land-long-lat-z files either in NetCDF or DAT formats.   The data covers land points only and excludes the Antarctica.   LWdown or surface incident longwave radiation (also known as downwards long-wave radiation flux ) is the surface incident longwave radiation averaged over the next six hours, measured in W/m2 at 6 hourly resolution and 0.5 x 0.5 degrees spatial resolution. </dcterms:description>     <dcterms:title xml:lang="en">WATCH Forcing Data (WFD) - 20th Century  LWdown (Surface incident longwave radiation) 1901-2001</dcterms:title>     <dcterms:isPartOf rdf:resource="http://eidchub.ceh.ac.uk/metadata"/>     <dcterms:issued rdf:datatype="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#dateTime">2012-01-03T14:45:00Z</dcterms:issued>     <documentcontainer:fileIdentifier xml:lang="en">e5d00d66-dcf5-4b0e-9346-f6205a336385</documentcontainer:fileIdentifier>     <documentcontainer:id xml:lang="en">e5d00d66-dcf5-4b0e-9346-f6205a336385</documentcontainer:id>   </documentcontainer:documentContainer> </rdf:RDF>
